channel.title: Posts on MATH 4180
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on MATH 4180

item.title: Week 1: Getting Started
item.description: Introduction to the Course and Tools Welcome to the course! Before we start any data science we will get to know each other, the tools we will use, and the policies of the course. If you have any questions about Week 1 materials please post them on Slack (you will soon see what Slack is) under the in-class channel. The following is the basic set-up for all tasks required each week.

item.title: Week 2: Intro to Visualizing Data
item.description: Grammar of Graphics & ggplot This week we will be discussing what qualities makes a graphic legible and how we can use R to implement readability using the Grammar of Graphics. Tasks Notes Links Due Data Viz: intro Slides ðŸ”— Recap video Follow Dr.Â B as she overviews the tasks to do for this week ðŸ“¼ Reading from MSDR book Chapter 2: Data visualization.

item.title: Week 3: Visualizing Data
item.description: Grammar of Graphics & ggplot contâ€™d This week we will be discussing ggplot functionality. Tasks Notes Links Due Webinar Tutorial about R Markdown basics. Post any questions in the questions channel. Watch when it suits your schedule. ðŸ“¼ Webinar Tutorial about dplyr Post any questions in the questions channel. ðŸ“¼ Watch at least the first half before Wed meeting Primers Check out with Work with Data and Tidy Your Data.

item.title: Week 4: Wrangling Data
item.description: Data Wrangling, pipe operators, and dplyr commands This week we will be discussing data wrangling techniques using the dplyr functions: select, filter, arrange, mutate, summarise, group_by Tasks Notes Links Due Cheatsheets You can find these by going to Help > Cheatsheets in RStudio as well ðŸ”— Reading from MDSR book Chapter 4. Post reading response (include one takeaway, one thing that would improve the reading, and any questions that you may have) in the reading_response_wrangling channel ðŸ“– Reading from R4DS book Chapter 5.

item.title: Week 5: Missing Data
item.description: Missing Data and the naniar package This week we will be discussing what to do when we have missing data and how to handle missingness in real-world healthcare data. Tasks Notes Links Due Reading from R4DS book Chapter 7. Pay special attention to sections 7.4 and 7.5. Post any questions in the Slack channel. ðŸ“– Code Tutorial Explore missing values using the naniar package ðŸ”— naniar resource This vignette (basically a how-to for using the package) includes most of the information from the code tutorial in a scrollable format ðŸ”— Project Work We will begin dealing with missing data.

item.title: Weeks 6-7: Feature Imputation and Engineering
item.description: Imputing Data and the mice package We will be discussing what to do when we have to impute missing data and the process for validating whether or not certain features should be included in our analyses. Tasks Notes Links Due Project Work We will begin imputing data. Using this .Rmd go over the methods presented with your group. Ask any questions in the Slack channel ðŸ”— mice package ðŸ”— mice resource ðŸ”— Updates for reading material: TBD

item.title: Week 8: Model Buliding
item.description: Building Models using recipes and evaluations from the tidymodels package We will be introducing how to implement models using the tidymodels package. Tasks Notes Links Due Project Work Intro to model building. Download the .Rmd here or visit the link to view in your browser ðŸ”— tidymodels package ðŸ”— tidymodels tutorial ðŸ“¼ parsnip logistic_reg() function Documentation on parameters and usage of logistic regression within the tidymodels framework ðŸ”— tidymodels model search For finding information and usage of models supported in the tidymodels ðŸ”—
